jobDescription: Job Description With more than 8500 people across five continents and the Pacific region, GHD is one of the world's leading engineering, environmental and construction services companies. Committed to the success of our clients and the communities in which we operate, we have an ongoing requirement for high caliber professionals to join our connected global network.  We have an opportunity in our Dallas, TX office for a Mid Level Environmental Geologist/Scientist/Engineer, who aspires to become an active employee in a vibrant, well-established company. The successful candidate will be responsible for:Performing a variety of duties for groundwater and remediation projects to include but not limited to: management, investigation, remediation and monitoring of environmental projects Plan and implement environmental field work such as monitoring well installation, groundwater monitoring and due diligence assessments Coordinate multiple projects and interface with clients, government agencies and other GHD offices Conducting environmental media sampling of air, groundwater, surface water, soil, etc. in accordance with applicable standards Field data collection and documentation for environmental site assessments Collection of waste characterization samples for profiling water, soils, sludges, etc. for proper disposal Supervision of remedial contractors and environmental service providers Preparation of routine correspondence and peer reviewed reports such as data reports, standardized documents, and work plans for internal and client review Coordinate and manage project tasksSkills, Competencies, Qualifications:B.S. or M.S. degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Geology or a related field of study 3 to 5 years of experience in environmental consulting field, including previous project management experience including the investigation, remediation, and monitoring of environmental projects Strong problem solving abilities and aptitude Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to effectively communicate with other technical professionals, clients, and regulatory officials is a must Positive attitude, very strong interpersonal skills Willingness to travel as required for potentially extended periods of time Self-starter, flexible team player, willing/able to work on a wide variety of tasks Must reside in Dallas, TX or surrounding area Working knowledge of Federal and State (TCEQ) environmental regulations is desirable OHSA 40-hour HAZWOPER training considered an asset As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status or veteran status.  To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to the link below.  No phone calls please and no third party firms. This position does not offer visa sponsorship. #LI-DW1
